Job Information

Job Title:                                Research Program Manager

Job Status:                             Full-time

Grade:                                    $75,000 – $80,000/Year

Manager’s Title:                   BEKH Directors

 Department:                         BEKH, Sprott School of Business

Target Start Date:                   February 14, 2022

Carleton University is strongly committed to fostering diversity within its community as a source of excellence, cultural enrichment, and social strength. We encourage applications from those who would contribute to diversifying our university including, but not limited to women; visible minorities; First Nations, Inuit, and Métis peoples; persons with disabilities; and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expressions.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit resumes with cover letter outlining how their experience relates to the Job Requirements. The target start date is as early as February 14, 2022, and applications will be accepted and reviewed as they arrive until the position is filled.

Send your resume and cover letter to bekh@carleton.ca.

Job Summary

The Dream Legacy Foundation (DLF) and Carleton University Sprott School of Business and Black Entrepreneurship Knowledge Hub (BEKH) is a critical national network of research hubs involved in community-based research, with a mission to improve the lived experiences of the Black community. Through collaboration with a network of multidisciplinary researchers and in linking these with community-based researchers and practitioners and by adopting a regional community-based strategy, the BEKH will co-create and co-generate research that will deliver important knowledge, insights and outcomes that resonates with the local regional needs of Black entrepreneurs, community members and organizations across Canada.

To accomplish this important mission, the BEKH seeks applications for the position of Research Program Manager. Reporting to the BEKH Directors, the Research Program Manager is responsible for ensuring effective operations of the Central Hub which operates out of Carleton’s Innovation Hub and providing oversight to Regional Hub operations. In the Central Hub, this includes responsibility for financial, human, research, and office management and encompasses managing consolidated quarterly reporting to the government ministry of Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED) on Central and Regional Hub research and community engagement and research activities, research deliverables, communications, and budget consolidation activities.

The Research Program Manager will be based in the Central Hub in Carleton University’s Innovation Hub and will work closely with the DLF, the BEKH Directors, Regional Hub leads, the Sprott School of Business, Innovation Hub staff, the BEKH Advisory Board and the BEKH Research Advisory Committee to ensure that the BEKH fulfils its national mandate and objectives and its commitment to Black entrepreneurs, community members and organizations across Canada.

Key Accountabilities

Operations Management

  • ensures the effective management of all aspects of day-to-day operations for the BEKH in coordination with DLF and the Regional Hub network
  • ensures the provision of effective administrative and governance support to the DLF, Central Hub, Regional Hubs, the BEKH Advisory Board and the BEKH Research Advisory Committee
  • onboards all new regional partners
  • provides leadership support to each of the Directors, the Advisory Board, and the Research Advisory Committee  
  • ensure that the Regional Hub network and Carleton University fulfils its fiduciary and legal obligations as well as internal and external governance and accountability requirements
  • facilitates short-term and long-term operational and strategic planning for the Central Hub

Financial Management

  • manages the financial affairs for the BEKH network 
  • manages and reports on the central operational budget and regionally funded research project budgets
  • makes decisions about and executing service agreements where applicable
  • establishes quarterly operating budgets
  • monitors research and operational costs  
  • prepares budget submissions
  • reconciles all financial activities
  • facilitates applications for additional funding

Planning and Reporting

  • participates in the long-term strategic planning and achievement of identified goals and objectives for the BEKH
  • leads ongoing operational planning for the BEKH including prioritization, resource allocation, and scheduling
  • develops, monitors, and reports on KPIs and performance targets
  • identifies operational risks, completes program/service reviews, and develops recommendations and action plans
  • develops externally focused materials to support program awareness and participation
  • ensures government legislation, governance structures, policies and procedures are adhered to
  • contributes to development and alignment of internal policies and procedures 
  • develops policies and procedures and templates related to the operational activities of the Central and Regional Hubs
  • collects, assembles, develops, uploads, and provides agendas and information packages for meetings—files, reports, correspondence, research, and background materials
  • composes, drafts, edits, proofreads, and formats correspondence, memos, agenda, and briefing notes
  • coordinates the preparation and flow of information and materials for all Central Hub, Advisory Board and Research Advisory Committee meetings
  • maintains records, reports and filing systems in accordance with corporate best practices  

Relationship Management

  • collaborates and liaises with Carleton University stakeholders, the Dream Legacy Foundation, the Regional Hubs, and regional community partners  
  • consults with DLF, BEKH Directors, Regional Hub network, understands research context, provides advice and guidance related to network program and activities
  • provides day-to-day operational leadership and guidance to Regional Hub leads and support staff  
  • resolves escalated issues and complaints and interacts across the Regional Hub network with a focus on the provision of administrative and   operational support and the exchange, collection, and dissemination of information
  • ensures effective and accurate communication and implementation of decisions on both the national and regional levels of the network
  • facilitates and promotes network engagement through communicating and moving forward the BEKH’s strategic priorities
  • explains, clarifies, and exchanges process and procedural information

Strategic Development and Implementation

  • supports the central hub and regional hubs in identifying and actioning strategic community engagement and research priorities
  • integrates activities and resources related to the actioning of priorities and objectives in line with the BEKH’s mandate
  • provides leadership in engaging and motivating Regional Hub leads and regional support staff to be actively engaged and participating in the network
  • identifies ongoing opportunities for the BEKH’s engagements and activities that contribute to its reputation and visibility

People Leadership

  • oversees all workforce planning with a focus on resource and talent requirements for the Central Hub
  • leads recruitment and staffing activities
  • manages day-to-day operations, develops, and implements unit-wide training plans and programs
  • prioritizes and delegates work for direct reports, ensures work quality and completion, manages scheduling and attendance, conducts on-going performance management and annual reviews
  • provides guidance and advice on escalated and challenging issues
  • monitors Central Hub culture and productivity and intervenes when necessary

Communication and Marketing

  • ensures effective overall communication and knowledge dissemination strategies across academic, practitioner and community channels as well as over digital channels and platforms the BEKH network  
  • creation of strategic marketing and communications plan to promote the BEKH network in collaboration with DLF, the Sprott School of Business and the Innovation Hub
  • coordinates regional and national digital and print public facing materials  
  • tracks communications across all hubs and channels for reporting back to ISED
  • liaises with Regional Hub networks to distribute information and materials related to the promotion of BEKH and its priorities
  • identifies and facilitates the translation of key communication materials and assets into French

Impact

  • to the accuracy and timelines of Central Hub deliverables and administrative services

Job Requirements

Core Knowledge

  • knowledge of the lived experiences of Black entrepreneurs, community members and organizations
  • operational management and leadership experience in academic and/or community organization context
  • knowledge of governance procedures and practices
  • knowledge of building and maintaining networks relationships with stakeholders across public, private, not-for-profit, community service providers, advocacy groups and academic institutions
  • strong knowledge of research program delivery models, policy and procedures development, planning, budgeting, performance measurement management and human resources
  • office administration as well as the broader university academic units, divisions and department structures policies, procedures, and processes
  • excellent multi-tasking, time management, written and verbal communication skills
  • office productivity software and databases, internet browsers and search engines, discipline-specific software, enterprise software, and technology devices
  • bilingualism is an asset

Education

  • Master’s degree preferred with experience

Experience

  • minimum of five years of research program management and administration or commensurate experience
  • experience working with community, government, and non-for-profit organizations
  • minimum of three years of supervision and leadership experience providing governance, direction and support to a national association, network or board of directors including managing day-to-day operations and supporting multiple working groups

Physical, Visual, Auditory, and Concentration Demands

  • uses keyboards, mouse, computers/tablet, and other technology devices
  • heighten auditory demands for taking minutes during meetings
  • requires coordinating and organizing face-to-face and virtual meetings to engage the members
  • concentration and visual effort during composing, drafting, editing, and proofreading documents including cross checks of information and data accuracy
  • concentration and visual effort during updating, revising, and adjusting calendars and schedules
  • responds to interruptions to workflow that impact concentration demands

Working Environment

  • expectation of working in an in-person office environment (on-site at Carleton University)
  • on-going requirements for computer-based work and attendance at meetings
  • attends events and meetings outside of regular work hours
  • may be limited travel
